page.title: 03Housing
page.content: There are two small collections of houses in the area. The oldest, is the village of Borgue. This small village is situated round a 'T' junction where the minor road from Kirkandrews joins the B727. There are 20 privately owned stone built houses built along these roads in ribbon development, and within the last four years, four small brick council houses have been built for retired people. Apart from these four houses there has been no development since the turn of the century. About one kilometre along the Kirkandrews road is another collection of seven stone built houses, one of which is occupied by the village blacksmith, and another by the local joiner. This area is kown as Sunnybrae, where eight five apartment flats were built in 1950 by the county council.
